title: Emperor Claudius dies from poisoning under mysterious circumstances; his 17-year-old stepson Nero succeeds him.
text: Emperor Claudius dies from poisoning under mysterious circumstances; his 17-year-old stepson Nero succeeds him.

title: Vandals and Alans cross the Pyrenees and appear in Hispania.
text: Vandals and Alans cross the Pyrenees and appear in Hispania.

title: The present church building at Westminster Abbey is consecrated.
text: The present church building at Westminster Abbey is consecrated.

title: Hundreds of Knights Templar in France are simultaneously arrested by agents of Phillip the Fair, to be later tortured into a "confession" of heresy.
text: Hundreds of Knights Templar in France are simultaneously arrested by agents of Phillip the Fair, to be later tortured into a "confession" of heresy.

title: Rinchinbal Khan, Emperor Ningzong of Yuan, becomes the Khagan of the Mongols and Emperor of the Yuan dynasty, reigning for only 53 days.
text: Rinchinbal Khan, Emperor Ningzong of Yuan, becomes the Khagan of the Mongols and Emperor of the Yuan dynasty, reigning for only 53 days.

title: Because of the adoption of the Gregorian calendar, this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.
text: Because of the adoption of the Gregorian calendar, this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.

title: A Swedish–Dutch fleet defeats the Danish fleet at Fehmarn and captures about 1,000 prisoners.
text: A Swedish–Dutch fleet defeats the Danish fleet at Fehmarn and captures about 1,000 prisoners.

title: Port Royal, the capital of French Acadia, falls in a siege by British forces.
text: Port Royal, the capital of French Acadia, falls in a siege by British forces.

title: The Whirlpool Galaxy is discovered by Charles Messier.
text: The Whirlpool Galaxy is discovered by Charles Messier.

title: The United States Continental Congress orders the establishment of the Continental Navy (the predecessor organization of the United States Navy).
text: The United States Continental Congress orders the establishment of the Continental Navy (the predecessor organization of the United States Navy).

title: In Washington, D.C., the cornerstone of the United States Executive Mansion (known as the White House since 1818) is laid.
text: In Washington, D.C., the cornerstone of the United States Executive Mansion (known as the White House since 1818) is laid.

title: French Revolutionary Wars: Austro-Prussian victory over Republican France at the First Battle of Wissembourg
text: French Revolutionary Wars: Austro-Prussian victory over Republican France at the First Battle of Wissembourg

title: War of 1812: Battle of Queenston Heights: As part of the Niagara campaign in Ontario, Canada, United States forces under General Stephen Van Rensselaer are repulsed from invading Canada by British and native troops led by Sir Isaac Brock.
text: War of 1812: Battle of Queenston Heights: As part of the Niagara campaign in Ontario, Canada, United States forces under General Stephen Van Rensselaer are repulsed from invading Canada by British and native troops led by Sir Isaac Brock.

title: The Declaration of Independence of the Mexican Empire is publicly proclaimed.
text: The Declaration of Independence of the Mexican Empire is publicly proclaimed.

title: In New York City, Henry Jones and 11 others found B'nai B'rith (the oldest Jewish service organization in the world).
text: In New York City, Henry Jones and 11 others found B'nai B'rith (the oldest Jewish service organization in the world).

title: A majority of voters in the Republic of Texas approve a proposed constitution that, if accepted by the U.S. Congress, will make Texas a U.S. state.
text: A majority of voters in the Republic of Texas approve a proposed constitution that, if accepted by the U.S. Congress, will make Texas a U.S. state.

title: First known conversation in modern Hebrew by Eliezer Ben-Yehuda and friends.
text: First known conversation in modern Hebrew by Eliezer Ben-Yehuda and friends.

title: The International Meridian Conference votes on a resolution to establish the meridian passing through the Observatory of Greenwich, in London, as the initial meridian for longitude.
text: The International Meridian Conference votes on a resolution to establish the meridian passing through the Observatory of Greenwich, in London, as the initial meridian for longitude.

title: The Georgia Institute of Technology is founded in Atlanta, Georgia, United States.
text: The Georgia Institute of Technology is founded in Atlanta, Georgia, United States.

title: Edward Emerson Barnard discovers D/1892 T1, the first comet discovered by photographic means, on the night of October 13–14.
text: Edward Emerson Barnard discovers D/1892 T1, the first comet discovered by photographic means, on the night of October 13–14.

title: The Boston Red Sox win the first modern World Series, defeating the Pittsburgh Pirates in the eighth game.
text: The Boston Red Sox win the first modern World Series, defeating the Pittsburgh Pirates in the eighth game.

title: Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught and Strathearn, becomes the first Governor General of Canada of royal descent.
text: Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught and Strathearn, becomes the first Governor General of Canada of royal descent.

title: The Battle of the Hohenzollern Redoubt marks the end of the Battle of Loos in northern France, World War I.
text: The Battle of the Hohenzollern Redoubt marks the end of the Battle of Loos in northern France, World War I.

title: The "Miracle of the Sun" is witnessed by an estimated 70,000 people in the Cova da Iria in Fátima, Portugal.
text: The "Miracle of the Sun" is witnessed by an estimated 70,000 people in the Cova da Iria in Fátima, Portugal.

title: The Soviet republics of Russia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia sign the Treaty of Kars with the Grand National Assembly of Turkey to establish the contemporary borders between Turkey and the South Caucasus states.
text: The Soviet republics of Russia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia sign the Treaty of Kars with the Grand National Assembly of Turkey to establish the contemporary borders between Turkey and the South Caucasus states.

title: Ankara replaces Istanbul as the capital of Turkey.
text: Ankara replaces Istanbul as the capital of Turkey.

title: Jože Plečnik unveils his memorial to Napoleon on the Square of French Revolution, Ljubljana, Slovenia.
text: Jože Plečnik unveils his memorial to Napoleon on the Square of French Revolution, Ljubljana, Slovenia.

title: World War II: The new government of Italy sides with the Allies and declares war on Germany.
text: World War II: The new government of Italy sides with the Allies and declares war on Germany.

title: World War II: Riga, the capital of Latvia is occupied by the Red Army.
text: World War II: Riga, the capital of Latvia is occupied by the Red Army.

title: France adopts the constitution of the Fourth Republic.
text: France adopts the constitution of the Fourth Republic.

title: The Pacific Northwest experiences a cyclone the equal of a Cat 3 hurricane. Winds measured above 150 mph at several locations; 46 people died.
text: The Pacific Northwest experiences a cyclone the equal of a Cat 3 hurricane. Winds measured above 150 mph at several locations; 46 people died.

title: The first game in the history of the American Basketball Association is played as the Anaheim Amigos lose to the Oakland Oaks 134–129 in Oakland, California.
text: The first game in the history of the American Basketball Association is played as the Anaheim Amigos lose to the Oakland Oaks 134–129 in Oakland, California.

title: An Aeroflot Ilyushin Il-62 crashes outside Moscow killing 174.
text: An Aeroflot Ilyushin Il-62 crashes outside Moscow killing 174.

title: Uruguayan Air Force Flight 571 crashes in the Andes mountains, near the border between Argentina and Chile. (By December 23, 1972, only 16 of the 45 total persons originally aboard were still alive when rescued.)[1]
text: Uruguayan Air Force Flight 571 crashes in the Andes mountains, near the border between Argentina and Chile. (By December 23, 1972, only 16 of the 45 total persons originally aboard were still alive when rescued.)[1]

title: A Bolivian Boeing 707 cargo jet crashes in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, killing 100 (97, mostly children, killed on the ground).
text: A Bolivian Boeing 707 cargo jet crashes in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, killing 100 (97, mostly children, killed on the ground).

title: The first electron micrograph of an Ebola viral particle is obtained by Dr. F. A. Murphy, now at U.C. Davis, who was then working at the C.D.C.
text: The first electron micrograph of an Ebola viral particle is obtained by Dr. F. A. Murphy, now at U.C. Davis, who was then working at the C.D.C.

title: Ameritech Mobile Communications (now AT&T) launched the first US cellular network in Chicago.
text: Ameritech Mobile Communications (now AT&T) launched the first US cellular network in Chicago.

title: End of the Lebanese Civil War. Syrian forces launch an attack on the free areas of Lebanon removing General Michel Aoun from the presidential palace.
text: End of the Lebanese Civil War. Syrian forces launch an attack on the free areas of Lebanon removing General Michel Aoun from the presidential palace.

title: An Antonov An-124 operated by Antonov Airlines registered CCCP-82002, crashes near Kiev, Ukraine killing eight.
text: An Antonov An-124 operated by Antonov Airlines registered CCCP-82002, crashes near Kiev, Ukraine killing eight.

title: The mining accident in Copiapó, Chile comes to an end as all 33 miners arrive at the surface after surviving a record 69 days underground awaiting rescue.
text: The mining accident in Copiapó, Chile comes to an end as all 33 miners arrive at the surface after surviving a record 69 days underground awaiting rescue.

title: A stampede breaks out on a bridge near the Ratangarh Mata Temple in Datia district, Madhya Pradesh, India during the Hindu festival Navratri, killing 115 people and injuring more than 110.
text: A stampede breaks out on a bridge near the Ratangarh Mata Temple in Datia district, Madhya Pradesh, India during the Hindu festival Navratri, killing 115 people and injuring more than 110.

title: The Maldives announces its decision to withdraw from the Commonwealth of Nations.
text: The Maldives announces its decision to withdraw from the Commonwealth of Nations.
